"There's a thin line between being a hero, and being a memory." -- Optimus

"Nothing is more precious than independence and liberty." -- Ho Chi Minh

"The end may justify the means as long as there is something that justifies the end." -- Leon Trotsky

"Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much." -- Helen Keller

"We cannot be sure of having something to live for unless we are willing to die for it." -- Che Guevara

"I have a wish. It as a fear as well - that in my end will be my beginning." -- Che Guevara

"Silence is argument carried out by other means." -- Che Guevara

"Yesterday is not ours to recover, but tomorrow is ours to win or lose." -- Lyndon B. Johnson

"He who has a why to live can bear almost any how." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

"Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment." -- Buddha
